newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: CRICKET-OPENER SOHAIL APOLOGISES TO PAKISTAN BOARD.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-OPENER SOHAIL APOLOGISES TO PAKISTAN BOARD.

text.p: Opener Aamir Sohail has apologised to the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) in a move to get his two-year ban from international and domestic cricket lifted.

A board spokesman said on Thursday the PCB council would meet within a week to decide whether to pardon Sohail or reduce the ban imposed last month for alleged violation of the board's code of conduct.

The apology, described as unconditional by the spokesman, follows a deal proposed last week by Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif's adviser on sports and culture, Mushahid Hussain, that Sohail must apologise and the PCB lift the ban.
A PCB disciplinary committee had announced the ban on April 16 after a month's suspension of the left-hander over a row with PCB chief executive Majid Khan during a domestic one-day game.
The three-man committee had found Sohail guilty of breaching the code of conduct by levelling what it called baseless charges of match-fixing and betting against some national team members.
Sohail has played 34 tests, scoring 2,103 runs at an average of 35.64.
